page.title: 09A NEW HOSPITAL, HUNTLYBURN
page.content: { Huntlyburn House}is 200 years old and was once owned by Sir Walter Scott's family. There were stables and gardeners' cottages which have been turned into offices.The house has a cricket ground which is next to the hospital. The hospital is called the Borders{District General Hospital}but most people call it the Huntlyburn Hospital.The hospital will have cost Â£30 millon to build.Inside it will have 3 levels.There will be{600 rooms {and 404 beds.}These rooms will be heated with coal.There will be{1000 {staff}working in the hospital.At the back there will be a mortuary and the seriously ill people will go to the back of the hospital.The hospital will have special rooms for old people who are unable to look after themselves. It will be a modern building, purpose built for Borders people of the 90's.
